author: B.L. van der Waerden
summary: Van der Waerden recommends his assistant Dr. Kurt Strebel, a promising young mathematician and student of Nevanlinna, for a fellowship at Princeton beginning autumn 1953. He highlights Strebel's work in complex analysis and Riemann surfaces, enclosing an evaluation of his Habilitationsschrift and listing his previous publications.
title: Fellowship Recommendation for Strebel
